doc.field: Photographs of houses in Sea Gate
Photographs of houses in Sea Gate

The Photographs of houses in Sea Gate consist of two black-and-white photographic prints depicting two different houses located in the Sea Gate neighborhood of Brooklyn, circa 1900 to 1920. Both photographs were taken during the day and show exterior views of the houses, along with their surrounding landscaped lawns. One photographic shows a group of people playing croquet on the lawn outside one of the houses, circa 1900.

The Photographs of houses in Sea Gate consist of two black-and-white photographic prints depicting two different houses located in the Sea Gate neighborhood of Brooklyn, circa 1900 to 1920. Both photographs were taken during the day and show exterior views of the houses, along with their surrounding landscaped lawns. One photographic shows a group of people playing croquet on the lawn outside one of the houses, circa 1900.
Gift of the Rye Historical Society, 1990. The photographs were originally donated to the Rye Historical Society from Agatha Alling Durland.
